oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Nancy Alexander oath of allegiance
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Oath of allegiance taken by Mrs. Nancy Alexander of Lincoln County, Tennessee. In the oath, Mrs. Alexander swears to "maintain the national sovereignty paramount to all County, State or Confederate powers." She also agrees to "forever oppose secession, rebellion, and disintegration of the Federal Union" and to "disclaim and denounce all faith and fellowship with the so called Confederate States." The original is in the collections of the Lincoln County Archives.
